Authors: M. Amalia Scataglini, Fernando Omar Zuloaga
Title:
Morronea, A New Genus Segregated from Panicum (Paniceae,
Poaceae) Based on Morphological and Molecular Data
Keywords:
Gramineae, grasses, Panicum, Parviglumia, phylogeny,
taxonomy.
Abstract:
Taxonomic features of species of Panicum section
Parviglumia are reviewed and compared with those of other taxa in tribe
Paniceae. The new genus Morronea, including six species ranging from
Mexico to Argentina, is proposed on the basis of morphological
characters. They are plants growing at forests edges, with
membranous-ciliate ligules, lower glume reduced, 1/6 to Â¼ the spikelet
length, lower palea and lower flower absent, and upper anthecium
indurate with simple papillae and conspicuous macrohairs all over its
surface, and chloroplast ndhF sequences to include six species ranging
from Mexico to Argentina. The new combinations: Morronea arundinariae,
M. cayoensis, M. guatemalensis, M. incumbens, M. parviglumis, and M.
trichidiachnis are proposed and the new genus is compared with other
genera of the tribe Paniceae.
